definition: lit. drawing a tiger using a cat as a model (idiom); fig. to follow a model and get things more or less right but without capturing the spirit of the subject/uninspired imitation

sentences.english: Disney was always parroting the feature-length mainstream films of his day. 3 So did many others.
sentences.chinese: 迪斯尼一生中经常从主流的长片中照猫画虎。

definition: lit. to draw a dipper with a gourd as a model (idiom)/fig. to copy slavishly
lit. to draw a gourd from the model (idiom)/fig. to copy sth mechanically without attempt at originality
to try to draw a tiger but end up with a likeness of a dog (idiom)/to try to do sth overambitious and end up botching it

definition: lit. to draw a dipper with a gourd as one's model (idiom)/fig. to follow the existing pattern without modification
lit. Dong Shi imitates Xi Shi's frown (idiom)/fig. to mimick sb's idiosyncrasies but make a fool of oneself
to copy the way they walk in Handan (idiom)/slavishly copying others, one risks becoming a caricature
to try to draw a tiger but end up with a likeness of a dog (idiom)/to try to do sth overambitious and end up botching it
a wooden word-by-word reading
to pick up what others say (idiom); to pass off other people's opinions as one's own/to parrot
the attitude of mechanically borrowing (ideas etc)
lit. to build a cart behind closed doors/to be overly subjective and disregard the outside world (idiom)
to copy word for word
to know that it is so but not why it is so (idiom)

definition: solemn/presentable/decent
to parrot/to repeat uncritically what sb says

blind people touch an elephant (idiom, from Nirvana sutra 大般涅槃經|大般涅盘经[da4 ban1 Nie4 pan2 jing1]); fig. unable to see the big picture/to mistake the part for the whole/unable to see the wood for the trees
